alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 11 at 3:37AM EST until November 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Broward and Coastal Miami-Dade Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest tide of the day is expected late this morning and early this afternoon for the Miami-Dade and Broward beaches.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County
